examples: Lower energy consumption means less pollution.
I have decided to cut down on my consumption of dairy products due to lactose intolerance.
Consumption of fluid milk plummeted from 247 pounds per person in 1975 to 146 pounds per person in 2018.
Cheese consumption has more than doubled since the mid 1970s.
Butter consumption also rose in the same time from about four point seven pounds to five point eight.
words.defineEn: the action or process of using a resource such as energy or food
words.defineVi: hành động hoặc quá trình sử dụng một nguồn tài nguyên như năng lượng hoặc thực phẩm

words.defineEn: tending to consume or use often wastefully
words.defineVi: có xu hướng tiêu thụ hoặc sử dụng thường xuyên một cách lãng phí

examples: It pulls at the heartstrings of every agent out there to see a young lady or anyone jeopardized by these conditions.

Mitsumi could have jeopardized its relationship with Sony by giving Microsoft the same technology.
If we solely rely on digital currencies and there is a massive power outage or a hack, it could jeopardize the entire system.
Trump suggested that Pan Am's financial struggles might jeopardize the airline's safety, and his remarks soon came back to bite him.
words.defineEn: to put something in danger of harm, loss, or negative consequences
words.defineVi: để đặt một cái gì đó có nguy cơ bị tổn hại, mất mát, hoặc hậu quả tiêu cực

examples: You watch Jeopardy, man!
- This is "Jeopardy."
But the future of Takayuki's job is in jeopardy.

After years of financial peril, in 2012, the hospital was losing so much money, its future was in jeopardy.
words.defineEn: in the risk of being harmed, damaged, or destroyed
words.defineVi: trong nguy cơ bị tổn hại, hư hỏng hoặc phá hủy

examples: Certainly, what we're seeing in the last couple of days doesn't augur well.

words.defineEn: predict from an omen

words.defineVi: một sự kiện được trải nghiệm như chỉ ra những điều quan trọng sắp tới

examples: The storekeeper changed my dollar bill for four quarters.
The business has already closed the books for this quarter.
The company's new product line contributed to a significant increase in its overall yield for the quarter.
Things are looking good for the company after they revealed their financial results for the quarter.

words.defineEn: divide into quarters
words.defineVi: chia thành các phần tư

examples: Johnson: A sextet there, here's a quartet there.

The harmonizing and vocal stylings of many boy bands from the early 1980s to the early 2000s trace their roots back to the vocalizations of black a cappella barbershop quartets from the first half of the 20th century.
words.defineEn: a musical piece written for four singers or instruments
words.defineVi: một tác phẩm âm nhạc viết cho bốn ca sĩ hoặc nhạc cụ

examples: Historians believe that an actor probably transcribed the first quarto his memory and that that actor probably only played really small parts.

There are two quartos, one from 1603 and another from 1604, and then the Folio edition from 1623 The second quarto and the folio are somewhat similar, although the first was probably based on Shakespeare’s notes and the second based on seeing the play in performance.

There are two quartos, one from 1603 and another from 1604, and then the Folio edition from 1623 The second quarto and the folio are somewhat similar, although the first was probably based on Shakespeare’s notes and the second based on seeing the play in performance.
words.defineEn: a book size that results from folding printed sheets twice to create four leaves, making eight pages
words.defineVi: kích thước sách là kết quả của việc gấp các tờ in hai lần để tạo thành bốn trang, tạo thành tám trang

words.defineEn: a malarial fever that recurs every fourth day
words.defineVi: sốt rét tái phát cứ sau bốn ngày

examples: Misogynists struck back against these protests.

examples: But if there’s one thing we can say about misogyny: It ain’t rational.

Less misogyny, but still got that swagger.

words.defineVi: thể hiện hoặc trải qua sự hối hận sâu sắc hoặc cảm giác tội lỗi vì một hành động sai trái mà một người đã phạm phải

examples: Don't let these fanatics have nuclear weapons.

examples: It beats out McDonald's in and out and Burger King in that category, which shows that its fans are highly loyal to the point of fanaticism.

examples: Life in our universe can sometimes be precarious.
Of course, even these more precarious prom fantasies are not accessible to all American teens.
Thomas wrote a confidential memo in 1989 about the precarious position the industry was in.

examples: The thrill-seeker who skydived without proper safety precautions ended up with a serious injury.

Even though she was fully aware of the risks, Susan refused to take the necessary precautions to prevent the spread of a contagious disease, proving that selfishness knows no bound.
